title: [BUG] Predict residuals error with hierarchical forecaster
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
The `predict_residuals` function doesn't work for me when the forecaster is hierarchical/panel type

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.forecasting.base import ForecastingHorizon
from sktime.forecasting.exp_smoothing import ExponentialSmoothing
from sktime.utils._testing.hierarchical import _bottom_hier_datagen

# generate a 3 node hierarchy ts
y = _bottom_hier_datagen(
    no_bottom_nodes=3,
    no_levels=1,
    random_seed=111,
)
fh = ForecastingHorizon([1, 2], is_relative=True)

# forecast all levels
forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing(trend="add", seasonal="additive", sp=12)
forecaster.fit(y)
# error to do with fh
print(forecaster.predict_residuals(y))

```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

Same behavior as for a single level, except returns a multi-index object 

```python
# forecast one level works fine
y_single = y.loc[("l1_node01")]
forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing(trend="add", seasonal="additive", sp=12)
forecaster.fit(y_single)
# works fine
print(forecaster.predict_residuals(y_single))

```

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

Workaround for now

```python

fh_resid = ForecastingHorizon(
    y.index.get_level_values(-1).unique(), is_relative=False
)
resid = y - forecaster.predict(fh=fh_resid)
print(resid)

```
